title: Trade finance: Letters of credit
personalDataVerified: Issuing bank name, beneficiary name, credit amount, payment terms, expiry date, required documents list
personalDataVisible: Credit status (active/expired/drawn). Link to issuing bank system (beneficiary and advising banks, requires authentication)
rationale: Prevents forged letters of credit in international trade. Domain binding verifies issuing bank legitimacy. High-value international trade transactions. Tamper-evident payment terms prevent fraud. UCP 600 (Uniform Customs and Practice) compliance. Prevents trade-based money laundering. Critical for exporters where LC authenticity guarantees payment from foreign buyers.
